messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] The old woman who lived in a shoe - new version
messages.msgSnippet: It is in a book called, Positively Mother Goose. The was a bold woman who lived in a shoe. She had many children and knew what to do. You are all lovable
messages.messageBody:
It is in a book called, "Positively Mother Goose."

The was a bold woman
who lived in a shoe.
She had many children
and knew what to do.

"You are all lovable
with special gifts," she said.
She hugged them all fondly
and tucked them in bed.


-pam

>
> Thanks --

messages.messageBody:
On Oct 3, 2008, at 2:36 PM, Adrean Clark wrote:

> I've been trying to search the archives but can't find the version of
> the old nursery rhyme that someone posted a year or so ago. It was a
> more positive version... Could someone post?

There's a book "Father Gander" that has more politically correct
versions of nursery rhymes that were actually pretty good.

http://tinyurl.com/3uc93x

It may have come from there. It's out of print but libraries probably
have it.

Joyce
